186023096.review: Assassin's Creed has been my childhood for long time. I don't really feel the same connection for the new generation games as I do for the older generation of the series, so I've been replaying all the older games and Rogue is special to me as it takes what we know about the Assassins and Templars and spins in on our heads. We're so used to Templars being portrayed as the bad people that we've never really considered the Assassins to be chaotic and bad in their own right until now, which is why I find Rogue so special. Shay is one of my favourite protagonists and while AC:R is very wonky to play on PC with a remote, it's still enjoyable.

186011966.review:
Uma análise rápida e gostosa:

Galera, esse jogo ele médio pra bom, já vou mandando logo o papo pra vocês!
Pra quem não jogou a saga e pegar ele por primeiro, vai ter uma experiência muito boa e interessante, mas pra quem já tá jogando novamente aí a visão muda um pouco. Esse jogo ele é um "Grapete" de tudo que vimos no AcBf e no Ac3, ele trás a mecânica de navegação, movimento e ataques do quarto jogo e a cidade e personagens conhecidos do terceiro, então não pense que é um jogo novo e sim apenas um adeus pra essa geração.
Esse jogo é médio pra bom por que ele fecha a trilogia kenway e tampa um buraco da saga ao mesmo tempo que abre um enorme no assassin creed unity kkkkkkk porcaria né ubisoft! Tem uma história incrível e tem pra mim a, melhor dublagem de toda a saga o protagonista tem a voz do dublador: "Alexandre Moreno" e os outros personagens tem dubladores bons, algo que eu não vi do seu antecessor o AcBf.
Pra fechar com a lâmina oculta, eu tô na meta de platinar esse jogo, mas tô 70% e tá sendo uma luta por ser bastante cansativo e muito chato ficar pegando coletaveis pelo mapa (Ubisoft be like) então pra você guerreiro, mestre em querer platinar jogos da steam, tu vai lutar tá? Tu vai muito! Uma recomendação minha, faz tudo antes de zerar o game, assim você consegue poupar muito tempo da sua vida, faz no meio da sequência 4 ou perto de fechar ela, por que fazer depois de zerar fica muito chato, confia no pai aqui! Eu fiz isso com o ACBF! Um abraço e um beijo na busanfa de vocês e lembra-se  sempre.... SEMPRE comprem na promoção, os jogos da ubisoft são caros demais, um beijo e eu fui 😘 ♥️

185712807.review:
Смішна ситуація пишу цю рецензію вже 2 рази пройшовши гру. Це мій невеличкий символ зими.
Assassin’s Creed Rogue привертає увагу незвичним для франшизи підходом. Гра пропонує подивитися на конфлікт між асасинами та тамплієрами з іншого боку, що стало справжнім ковтком свіжого повітря для фанатів серії.

[h3] Сюжет і атмосфера [/h3]
Сюжет гри зосереджений на Шеї Патріку Кормаку – асасині, який розчарувався у своїй братії та став на бік тамплієрів. Це перша гра серії, де гравець більшу частину часу проводить у ролі тамплієра. Такий підхід дозволяє краще зрозуміти їхню мотивацію та цілі, що додає глибини традиційному протистоянню серії.

Події відбуваються у XVIII столітті під час Семирічної війни. Розробники вдало відтворили атмосферу Північної Америки: від засніжених лісів і гір до бурхливих морів і міст колоніального періоду. Гра напрочуд добре поєднує мрачний тон історії Шея із красою відкритого світу. Але сюжет дуже короткий і місцями не відповідає на питання які сама задає.

[h3] Геймплей [/h3]
Rogue значною мірою наслідує Assassin’s Creed IV: Black Flag, і це однозначно комплімент. Морські битви, дослідження островів, захоплення ворожих фортець – усе це збереглося і виглядає чудово. Шей має свій корабель під назвою "Морріган", який швидший і маневреніший за "Джекад", що робить морські бої ще динамічнішими. Але все-таки трішки перемудрили з пістолетами Puckle, вони вже занадто дизбалансні, ти можешь навідь не брати на абордаж корабель, а всіх розстріляти так. 
Гра також додає нові механіки: як тамплієр, Шей стикається з асасинами, які намагаються вбити його несподівано. Це змінює стиль гри, адже тепер вам доводиться не тільки вистежувати ворогів, а й самому бути обережним. Також у грі є нові типи зброї, такі як повітряна гвинтівка та гранати з різними ефектами.

[h3] Візуал і звук [/h3] 
Гра використовує той самий рушій, що й Black Flag, тож графіка виглядає чудово для свого часу. Особливо привабливі снігові пейзажі та детальні міста. Саундтрек гармонійно доповнює атмосферу гри, підкреслюючи як меланхолійність сюжету, так і драйв морських подорожей.

[h3] Недоліки [/h3]  
Головний мінус Rogue – відчуття, що це не повноцінна гра, а скоріше доповнення до Black Flag. Хоча сюжет непоганий, тривалість гри значно менша, ніж у деяких інших частинах серії. Деякі механіки, хоча й нові, не надто сильно змінюють загальний геймплей. Крім того, через одночасний вихід із Assassin’s Creed Unity гра отримала менше уваги, ніж заслуговує.

[h3] Висновок [/h3]  
Assassin’s Creed Rogue – це обов’язкова частина для фанатів серії, які хочуть побачити світ асасинів і тамплієрів з іншого боку. Незважаючи на те, що гра базується на механіках Black Flag, вона пропонує свіжий підхід до оповіді й атмосферу, яка залишає сильне враження. Якщо ви любите морські битви, красиві відкриті світи й глибокі моральні дилеми, Rogue вас не розчарує.

**Оцінка: 8/10**

185675084.review:
"The strongest decisions require the strongest will."

That's probably how I'll resume this game, and its protagonist : Shay Patrick Cormac. 

He's the embodiment of this sentence, which could very well be his credo. The game is basically an ersatz of Black Flag, but it has a unique flair to it due to Shay's adventure. We're finally fully in the spectrum of the Templars, and we see the millenium struggle through their side. 
It was very nice to see some old characters again, and the way Shay is navigating through them, and theses trouble waters was delightful to see. 

The gameplay is as fluid and smooth as Black Flag, so rest assured. It's very fun. 
The story is a bit short, which I found a bit sad, but it was intense and full of interesting plot points. So I can forgive the game for it. 

I really hope we'll be able to dwelve in the Templar side again more in the future...
In the meantime, 10/10 !

185632270.review: Great Game you will play for hours!

185629456.review:
[h1] La otra cara de la moneda [/h1]

Assassin's Creed Rogue es un título controversial porque salió al mismo tiempo que Assassin's Creed Unity lo cual hizo que éste último tape su protagonismo y esencia, sin embargo la gente con el tiempo logró darle reconocimiento y valorarlo por la narrativa y protagonista del juego.

[h3] Una historia diferente con las mismas mecánicas de siempre [/h3]

Rogue es el último juego en reciclar las mecánicas, gráficos y jugabilidad de Assassin's Creed III y Black Flag, éste es uno de los puntos válidos de las críticas de la comunidad debido a que Ubisoft tiene la costumbre de reciclar hasta el cansancio y no innovar en absolutamente nada. Black Flag fué un éxito debido a que amplió su horizonte y trajo toda una jugabilidad nueva, sin embargo Rogue el 80% del juego se siente como una skin ártica de su antecesor.

No todo es de color negro porque la historia que nos cuenta Rogue es una de las más importantes y interesantes de la franquicia, nos pone en la piel de Shay Patrick Cormac, un asesino de la hermandad colonial el cual después de ver como actuaba el credo terminó traicionándolos y integrándose a la orden de los templarios. Shay Cormac como personaje es muy importante debido al efecto mariposa que efectúa sobre las historias de [spoiler]todo Assassin's Creed III, Adéwalé y Arno [/spoiler], la narrativa es extravagante, siniestra, nos demuestra que ni los templarios ni los asesinos son los malos, ambos bandos tienen el mismo objetivo pero se rigen por una filosofía distinta, la diferencia está en quién está cegado de poder y cuales son sus intereses personales.

[h3] La duración y lo "nuevo" [/h3]

El juego es un comprimido de Black Flag, la historia dura aproximadamente 8/10 horas y es muy disfrutable, es muy fácil progresar en cuanto al dinero debido a que ahora podemos reformar viejos edificios y convertirlos en fuentes de ingresos, el juego tiene dos mapas oceánicos y uno en tierra, éste último aspecto logra que el título se expanda en duración, sin embargo después de un rato se vuelve completamente repetitivo y sin rumbo. alguna que otra mecánica nueva se integra a la jugabilidad a pié y al combate naval pero no diferencia casi nada con su antecesor y la calidad audiovisual del juego es prácticamente la misma.

[h3] ¿Es recomendable? [/h3]

Si te interesa continuar con la franquicia y escuchar el otro lado de la historia entonces te lo recomiendo completamente porque la trama y el protagonista son increíbles por igual, sin embargo, si buscas una experiencia completamente nueva en cuanto a gameplay entonces directamente juga un juego que sea de otra desarrolladora porque Ubisoft te va a hacer comer el mismo recalentado 3 veces. 

Por último debo decir que no considero para nada justo el trato de la comunidad hacia el videojuego debido a que se vea opacado por Unity, entiendo que éste último en su dia era una experiencia nueva y parte de lo que en su dia fué la Next Gen (PS4) pero al final si los comparas podes observar que la historia y protagonista de Rogue es 3 veces mejor que toda la narrativa de Unity y el desarrollo de Arno (igual Ubisoft también tomó la peor decisión de lanzar ambos juegos juntos).

[b] Puntuación: [/b][h2] 7,50 [/h2]

185394648.review:
Apesar de eu já ter jogado e zerado no meu Xbox One S e que agora no PC comprei em promoção e joguei e acabei de re-zerar a campanha, digo que Assassin's Creed Rogue é sem sombra de dúvidas um dos melhores AC da franquia da Ubisoft ao lado de AC IV: BF, AC III, e dos da saga do Ezio como AC II, AC Brotherhood e AC Revelations antes da era RPG em 2017.

Nele temos a história de Shay Patrick Cormac que nos mostra um ponto de vista interessante como plot dela de como o nosso protagonista Shay que nós o começamos a história com ele já na Ordem dos Assassinos e os motivos pelos quais ele acaba se rebelando e se tornando durante o desenrolar da trama da história parte da Ordem dos Templários como premissa do game sem deixar a desejar no quesito de história e no universo de AC que é incrível.

O mapa do game consiste no total de 3 mapas no geral, em dois grandes mapas a mar aberto para se explorar com seu navio e a pé nas ilhas e um terceiro mapa que é de Nova íorque do AC 3 para explorar da forma convencional (a pé). Os mapas de River Valley e Atlântico Norte você tem as ilhas pra furtar armazéns, tomar fortes e fortalezas e etc. Sem falar na caçada de animais que você precisa pra upar seu personagem em criar upgrades como no Far Cry.

Sobre a gameplay, ela é o que esperar dos Assassins Creed antigos o parkour e a movimentação mais datada pra hoje em dia mas ela não é um problema afinal pra quem já tá acostumado como eu. O combate contra os inimigos não é nada desafiador e é fácil de pegar a manha nos tipos de inimigos e combater eles.
O combate naval do game é bom e um pouco desafiador em navios mais fortes e pode ser meio difícil se no início do game você tiver que enfrentar navios mais fortes e você tem poucos upgrades no seu navio. Mas conforme você upa seu navio você consegue o bastante pra enfrentar os navios inimigos mais fortes. Usar estratégias de combate é bastante útil.

Quanto a bugs, AC Rogue na minha experiência não me apresentou nenhum bug do tipo comprometedor ou relacionado a Uplay - que é necessário pra você jogar, o que é chato mas enfim, né? - que tenha me atrapalhado ou me irritado durante minha jogatina, tirando os pequenos ''bugs'' como NPCs aparecendo na minha frente, coisa aqui ou alí que não interfere em absolutamente em nada.

Minha nota para AC Rogue é 8,3. É um excelente Assassin's Creed que ao final do game se passa entre AC 3 e também o início do Unity. Recomendo e vale a pena dar uma chance e jogar pra zerar a campanha apesar de ter falta das conquistas.

185384793.review:
Arguably just as good as Black Flag, i like to think on a way that, if Rogue was a Black Flag dlc, no one would complain. But moving on, since both are similar, lets compare which one gets the best out of the mechanics:
Combat: Its equal in both games, but i feel like rogue has more responsive controls, i tried SO MANY TIMES to do the double kill feature with pistol/dart on BF but 90% of the times it didnt work, but in rogue it always worked.
Story: Rogue for sure, as of now, i didnt finish the game, but im so immersed on it that i actually wonder if Ubisoft made this, characters SHOW their feelings, shocking right?
Naval Combat: No doubt Black Flag, Rogue introducts new mechanics that makes you so overpowered that its not even fair,  not to mention the water physics that are non existant here, your ship will be at blitz speed no matter if you are facing a high wave, also theres only two legendary ships on rogue and apparently no underwater mechanic.
Parkour and Stealth: 5 hours only into rogue and i already faced 3 bugs where i was supposed to grab a ledge but shay simply just didnt want to grab it and then i died from fall damage, but on my 60 hours of Black Flag i could tell maybe one or two bugs. Stealth on both are the same, you just use different tools to do the same.
In conclusion: PLAY BOTH.

185324387.review:
There is quite a big difference between AC:Rogue and AC:Black Flag, even though you can't really see them. Apart from the ship's design, and Shay having less guns compare to Edward, it does serves its own purpose respectively.


Edward's Jackdaw is, if you've played the game, a pirate ship. Seafaring in AC:Black Flag is a lot smoother and more open, and the enemies there are not as challenging even when you beg for it. Jackdaw may have less firepower and her weaponry may not able to match with the Morrigan, but she has better consistency and more reliable in quite a lot of sea environments (though it is more preferable to be in warm waters).

For Edward's equipment, he has the hidden blades, rope darts, smoke bombs, and a bunch of flintlocks. Certainly not a wide range of weapons, but he does wield dual scimitars/swords/rapiers of choice, which I'd say he looks really badass with them. I'd say his equipment is going in a direction of brute-forcing his way into success, since almost none of these items are for stealth and only the hidden blades and rope darts are, to a certain degree, a stealth weapon.


Shay's Morrigan on the other hand, is a cold water ship, designed to break through sheets of ice. She is a beast of a beauty when it comes to her upgrades, making her a dreadnought of the NA waters. When compare to the Jackdaw, the Morrigan has way more firepower when it comes to her broadsides and mortars, and the fire trail she leaves behind isn't designed to only sink ships but to overwhelm them, buying time to release more firepower. The puckle guns are extremely powerful, as it can easily sink gunboats and take down schooners much faster, as well as ripping off additional hull points from larger ships making the Morrigan very aggressive.

One cool thing about Shay himself is the air rifle, replacing the additional flintlocks. All of his other equipment are similar to Edward except for the sword-n-dagger combo and a unique rifle, a multi-purpose weapon. It can put enemies to sleep for you to infiltrate anywhere without being detected; make enemies become berserk to kill everyone around them and then themselves; distract enemies with loud noises; and even launching shrapnel grenades to take down large groups of enemies. Comparing to Edward, Shay uses precision and strategic tactics to win his game, avoid putting his hands directly into the problem until it is needed. And his offensive capabilities aren't so far from Edward himself, especially how Shay can launch darts and grenades in any given moment.


Overall, both Edward and Shay have astounding equipment and vessel to fit their playstyle. Edward can neutralize a group of enemies within moments and can withstand multiple groups at once even without his equipment. Shay has great potential to use his enemy's weapons to his own advantage, saving resources to further damage the enemy's structure and in quick succession. The Jackdaw has its astounding speed and great maneuverability in the sea, fitting for a pirate ship. The Morrigan carries its devastating cannons and resilient armor, perfect for digging holes into armors before they can do any fatal damage to the ship.

185247905.review:
어쌔신 크리드 로그까지가 7세대 콘솔 마지막이였고
그 다음 작인 유니티부터 8세대 콘솔로 넘어갔는데,
7세대 콘솔 어크 시리즈 중 에지오 트릴로지 다음으로 가히 최고다. 

스토리상 3와 4의 외전격 작품이지만
어크 전체 스토리라인에서 중요한 파트를 맡고있으며
스토리 흡입력과 입체적인 주인공의 서사가 굉장히 매력적이다.
암살단이 마냥 선이라고 생각했던 고정관념을 제대로 깨부쉈고,
수많은 명대사와 명반 OST를 남겼다.
4의 시스템을 재탕하고 분량이 짧다는 이유로 저평가 받았으나
고작 그걸로 폄하되기엔 상당히 아쉬운 작품. 

어쌔신 크리드의 팬이라면 반드시 거쳐가야할 타이틀이며,
어크 3의 매력없는 주인공과 4의 20시간짜리 해상전이 지겨웠다면
딱 적절한 분량과 간지나는 주인공이 더욱 더 맘에 들 것이다.

185208631.review:
Dans la lignée de Black Flag. On contrôle Shay Patrick Cormack, assassin en devenir qui bascule du côté de la Croix. Je me disais que jouer un templier, ce n'était pas pour moi. Et honnêtement, je trouve Shay moins charismatique que les précédents. Ceci dit, la psychologie du personnage est intéressante et l'histoire assez sympathique.

La partie actuelle suit je pense le même personnage que dans Black Flag. Abstergo a eu un soucis avec le réseau interne, vous devrez débloquer les ordinateurs et récupérer les tablettes. De loin, c'est la partie la plus ennuyante, cependant, elle apporte du Lore au jeu.

Quelques bugs sont présents. Toujours embêtant de voir son personnage vouloir a tout prix rester en haut alors qu'on veut descendre. J'ai même eu un bug fantastique, étant sur une aile d'un moulin en rotation, Shay s'est envolé dans le ciel et est retombé lourdement sur le sol, tête la première. Ca m'a refait ma journée.

En conclusion, je recommande le jeu, étant friand de la franchise. Je n'avais pas rejouer à AC depuis Black Flag, j'ai refait Unity et je viens de terminer Rogue. Je vais lancer le prochain, Syndicate.

Profitez bien !

185087721.review:
Released in 2014 as a companion title to Assassin’s Creed Unity, Assassin’s Creed Rogue takes a unique approach within the Assassin's Creed series by putting players in the shoes of an ex-Assassin turned Templar. Set in the late 18th century during the Seven Years' War, the game offers a fresh perspective on the ongoing conflict between the Assassins and Templars while retaining the signature open-world exploration, naval combat, and stealth action that the series is known for. Despite being somewhat overshadowed by Unity's release on next-gen consoles, Rogue provides a compelling narrative and refined gameplay mechanics that make it worth considering for both long-time fans and newcomers alike.

Story & Characters:

The central character of Assassin's Creed Rogue is Shay Cormac, an Assassin-turned-Templar, whose journey forms the heart of the game’s narrative. Shay's transformation from a loyal Assassin to a disillusioned Templar is one of the strongest elements of the game, providing a rare opportunity to see the story from the perspective of the Templar Order. This shift in viewpoint adds depth to the age-old conflict between Assassins and Templars, shedding light on the motivations of the Templars, who are often portrayed as antagonists in previous titles.

The game explores Shay’s betrayal of the Assassin Brotherhood after a tragic event shakes his faith in their cause. This journey from idealism to cynicism forms the emotional core of the story, and while it might not reach the dramatic heights of Assassin’s Creed II, it remains engaging and provides a solid, if familiar, narrative.

Shay’s interactions with other key figures, such as fellow Templars and former Assassin allies, are well-written and fleshed out, adding personal stakes to the overarching plot. However, the supporting cast isn’t as memorable as those in other entries, and some of the narrative beats can feel predictable, especially if you’re familiar with the series’ formula.

Gameplay:

Assassin’s Creed Rogue retains much of the core gameplay that has defined the series. It blends exploration, stealth, and combat into a seamless experience, with the open-world design allowing for plenty of freedom. The game takes place across three major regions: the North Atlantic, the River Valley, and New York. Each area is rich with historical detail and offers a variety of missions, side activities, and collectibles to discover.

One of the standout features is the naval combat, which first became a fan-favorite in Assassin’s Creed III and was further refined in Black Flag. As Shay, you captain the Admiral ship, and the naval segments are some of the best parts of the game. The controls are fluid, and the combat feels as intense and rewarding as ever. The addition of new mechanics like icebergs and fog that affect naval navigation adds an extra layer of challenge and realism to the experience.

On land, the game retains the series' iconic parkour and stealth mechanics, though they can sometimes feel repetitive. As a Templar, Shay's abilities differ slightly from those of previous Assassins. For example, instead of using a hidden blade, Shay employs a pistol for stealth kills, and his combat style is generally more aggressive, which offers a nice change of pace. Additionally, the Templar’s viewpoint on the world occasionally alters the tone of missions, making them feel somewhat darker than those of previous Assassins.

Missions in Rogue are diverse, ranging from story-driven objectives to more leisurely exploration and side quests. While the story missions are solid, the side activities—such as hunting, treasure hunting, and collectibles—can sometimes feel like filler. Still, they provide a lot of content for those who enjoy exploring every nook and cranny of the world.

Graphics and World Design:

Graphically, Assassin’s Creed Rogue doesn’t quite match the level of detail seen in Unity, given that it was developed for the previous generation of consoles (PS3, Xbox 360). However, the game still impresses with its environmental design, particularly the varied landscapes across the game’s different regions. The snow-covered mountains of the River Valley, the foggy waters of the North Atlantic, and the bustling streets of New York each feel distinct and full of life.

Character models and animations are generally solid, though there are some rough edges in the facial animations and NPC interactions, which occasionally feel a bit stiff. Nonetheless, the game's world design is expansive and immersive, filled with enough detail to make exploration enjoyable.

Sound Design and Music:

The sound design in Rogue is excellent, with ambient sounds, ship combat audio, and environmental noises all adding to the immersion. The music, composed by the talented Brian Tyler, complements the tone of the game well, blending sweeping orchestral themes with more intense, action-driven tracks during combat. The soundtrack is one of the stronger aspects of the game, helping to elevate key moments and making the world feel more alive.

Pros:

Unique perspective as a Templar protagonist.
Solid naval combat and exploration.
Engaging storyline with a personal arc for Shay Cormac.
Beautifully designed world and environments.
Strong soundtrack and sound design.
Cons:

Some repetitive mission structures and side content.
Supporting characters lack the depth of other titles.
Graphics are slightly dated compared to Unity.
Story can feel predictable, especially for long-time fans of the series.
Conclusion:

Assassin’s Creed Rogue is a solid entry in the Assassin’s Creed franchise that offers a fresh narrative perspective and refines the core gameplay elements that fans have come to expect. Its darker tone and shift in viewpoint make it a fascinating exploration of the Templar Order, and the naval combat is as fun as ever. However, the game is not without its flaws—some of the side content feels like filler, and the story can be a bit predictable at times.

For fans of the series, especially those who’ve enjoyed the naval gameplay in Black Flag or Assassin’s Creed III, Rogue is definitely worth a playthrough. While it may not reach the heights of the best entries in the franchise, it still delivers an enjoyable and memorable experience, particularly if you're looking for a change of perspective in the ongoing Assassin vs. Templar saga.

184948918.review:
Assassins Creed Rogue es una entrega "menor" dentro de la saga.

Los gráficos son acordes con la su "generación de consola" aunque en los modelos de los personajes protagonistas no luce del todo mal, al igual que las localizaciones, siempre y cuando no se observe con detenimiento, en cuyo caso se ve el cartón en seguida. Cumple adecuadamente.

El juego tiene un argumento atípico y se centra esta vez en la vida de un Templario, aunque con pasado en la Hermandad.

La trama es bastante corta y se puede solventar en pocas horas y la mayor parte del tiempo va a consistir en exploración y obtención de coleccionables.

El personaje principal es de los mejores a pesar de que su historia sea tan corta. Los personajes secundarios son simplemente unos trazos de personalidad dado el poco tiempo que aparecen en pantalla, por lo que a penas se puede valorar. No obstante, si están bien dibujados y tienen una función en la trama.

La historia en el presente tiene un desarrollo similar a otras entregas y su aportación es instrascendente, como mucho, sirve de refresco entre secuencias de la historia principal.

Respecto a misiones secundarios y otro tipo de contenido... el juego no tiene mucho que ofrecer aparte de coleccionables. Mientras que Unitiy adolecía de un exceso de contenido y con poco desarrollo, aquí directamente este contenido no existe y es claramente un Assassins por debajo de la calidad habitual (al menos en el presupuesto).

Respecto a las localizaciones y el periodo histórico, poco que decir, se repite otra vez (más o menos) la misma ambientación, lo que es una auténtica pena por que no hace sino desperdiciar a este personaje que merecía más por su propuesta. En cualquier caso los mapas cumplen su labor, hay una ciudad, Nueva York, y dos ambientaciones tipo "Islas", el Atlántico Norte y el River Side.

Las localizaciones son poco imaginativas e insulsas en la mayoría de los casos y apenas hay documentación histórica, algo que en las entregas clásicas aportaba muchísimo. En general, se ve poco trabajado.

Y es que Assassin's Creed Rogue es una versión "demo" de Black Flag combinado con Assassins Creed III. Una mezcla que le da un poco de cada cosa pero que no hace nada por desarrollar contenido nuevo salvo cuatro pinceladas con la introducción de la Hermandad como enemigos.

Respecto a las armas, algunas se desbloquean a destiempo, pero nada que ver con el desastre que hace Unity en este aspecto. La variedad es escasa y la repetición está presente en todos lados.

En el caso de los atuendos se echa en falta algo más de imaginación pero hay suficientes.

Respecto al barco, decir que la obtención de recursos es tediosa (a pesar de que en la versión deluxe se incluye un pequeño extra), lo que hace que te puedas pasar todo el juego y tengas que repetir localizaciones o destruir barcos para obtener el 100%. En cualquier caso, no hay novedades relevantes en mecánicas y al final repite la ya conocida fórmula.

En conclusión, Rogue es una entrega con un argumento muy interesante pero que se queda corto en la duración, con unas mecánicas jugables ya conocidas y explotadas hasta la saciedad. El juego es entretenido y no se hace tan desesperante como Unity, quizás en las últimas horas de juego, sí que puede resultar más pesado, pero al final es una experiencia positiva aunque la calidad del juego sea mediocre y no aporte novedades.

184886947.review:
最开始是有中文的，现在开始不支持中文了，游戏文件内还能找到中文的文件，也就是说并没有删中文的汉化文件，只是单纯不给中国玩家用，如果不想赚钱建议直接别在国区卖好了；别的都是没钱汉化或者没有意识到需要汉化，你倒好了自己原版有汉化现在直接自己禁了汉化，不知道的还以为原版就没有汉化，结果打开游戏原文件一看里面又有汉化的文件，咋了马克龙时不时领一张戴高乐体验卡，你育碧也玩起时不时仇中时不时想赚米这套了？简单来说就是端起碗吃饭放下碗就骂娘，一点家教是没有，虚伪白皮猪。
然后是育碧传统艺能Uplay平台验证问题，老连不上不能很好的开始游戏，体验极差。

概括一下两个问题：本身有自己的中文但是莫名其妙搞歧视就自己取消中文了（虽然没删中文汉化文件），然后是Uplay平台连不上拉胯问题。

我要不是买的早一直没怎么玩，我就退款了。

Em questão de gameplay, tem alguns elementos novos ou modificados bem interessantes, mas em minha singela opinião um dos únicos problemas (e o pior pra mim, por mais que não seja tão ruim) do jogo é ser um pouco repetitivo em alguns tipos de missões e coisas a fazer para completar regiões e tudo mais. Fora isso, uma coisa que incomodou mas não tanto foi que por mais que tenha esses elementos novos eu senti que tem muita, mas muuuuuita coisa copiada e colada direto e reto do black flag meio na cara dura demais, ok que eram coisas legais e tal, mas ficou esse gostinho de só querer fazer rápido e não implementar algo muito novo na gameplay desse jogo.

Agora em questão da história, eu amei esse jogo, acho que todo mundo concorda que é legal demais jogar com um personagem por essa perspectiva dos templários. E a cena que faz com que o Shay vire essa chavinha na cabeça dele mexeu comigo tbm, então achei muito bem feito mesmo essa parte. 

Enfim, recomendo pela história. A gameplay tbm recomendo se não estiver cansado da do black flag kkkkk.

184455493.review:
Assassin's Creed Rogue is a remarkable blend of both III and IV Black Flag, both in terms of recurring characters, a returning setting (New York) and familiar mechanics. Unlike Black Flag, which has a significant con when it comes to the Kenway's Fleet bug, this game doesn't share that complication. It does, however, share recurring troubles in its mechanics as the aforementioned titles. I will proceed with these first and foremost, then lead into the positives--that way you can decide for yourself if the game is worth your money.

  The primary issue that seems to plague the older games of the franchise, and is especially prevalent in the colonial era games--this does include Liberation--is a fault parkour script. For whatever reason, Shay sometimes struggles to acknowledge that he can climb up onto or over a particular obstacle such as a building. This can result in a sudden loss of momentum, and Shay repeatedly climbing but falling down every time you try to climb over the same spot. This is resolved by backing away and trying again at a different speed or angle, but is a frustrating occurrence. This can also happen during tree parkour, in which Shay tries to climb up the trunk of a tree whose branch he is standing on, rather than trying to circle the trunk to the branch on the other side. When it comes to tailing or evading detection, this can be especially agitating.

  On the flip side, the game romantically blends Assassin's Creed III and Assassin's Creed IV Black Flag, providing not just sailing--this time with a colder setting, and a river setting--but also returning New York to the franchise, along with familiar faces. Seeing a younger Achilles in his own robes is such a treat! Shay's starting robes feel very possible in actual history, as opposed to other main Assassins of the franchise, and his later robes develop into something beautiful with its blacks and reds! I also find the Morrigan, Shay's brig, to be far more efficient at boarding ships, thanks to the Puckle gun. It's fun to explore, fun to engage in ship combat, and fun to hunt and be hunted by Stalkers.

  It goes without saying that, despite its minor hiccups, I highly recommend this game to anyone experiencing the franchise. Even its price is a non-issue, because if you're on Steam, you'll be getting it on sale anyway.

P.S. I forgot to add this into the review, but it can be found in my review of Black Flag, of which is carries the same fighting mechanics. The combat is dumb'd down from III's and II's, and sometimes your counters aren't registered. It can be very frustrating, but a quick deploy of your tools can generally keep you in the fight.

Copy and paste of Black flag, one of the main reasons it's actually a good AC game.
The fact that you play as the "bad guy" for once is actually interesting, breathes some fresh air into the series, playing the story as a templar.
The new systems are also cool, I don't recall being able to be boarded in Black flag, the "stalker" system is kinda mediocre tho, it just uses the sounds from black flag multiplayer and they're mostly just an annoyance while exploring, constantly hearing the whispering sounds while they're close is cool and all but it gets annoying really fast.

Overall decent game, play this if you were a fan of the naval combat in black flag and wanted to experience it with a different story. Of course in the end it's mostly just a copy and paste. 7,5/10

184243735.review:
Assassin’s Creed Rogue предлагает уникальный взгляд на серию, показывая конфликт ассасинов и тамплиеров глазами Шэя Кормака, бывшего ассасина, перешедшего на сторону тамплиеров. Сюжет цепляет своей драматичностью и свежестью, особенно моменты, связанные с предательством братства. Однако история не достигает глубины, присущей лучшим играм серии, оставляя ощущение вторичности.
Геймплей практически полностью заимствован из Assassin’s Creed IV: Black Flag - морские сражения, исследование, охота за сокровищами. Несмотря на все еще увлекательные бои на море, повторяющиеся задания быстро наскучивают. Rogue ощущается скорее как дополнение, чем полноценная игра.
Собрать все достижения - задача утомительная и лишенная удовлетворения. Большая часть активности превращается в монотонный гринд, что заметно снижает удовольствие от завершения игры на 100%. Rogue стоит пройти ради сюжета, но перфекционизм в этой игре скорее разочарует.

184220741.review:
Я бы выделил эту игру из серии про Американскую революцию. Здесь намного интереснее сделаны локации, лучше реализовано улучшение корабля, улучшение города. Задумка, что ты теперь Тамплиер, который охотится на ассасинов выглядит необычно и свежо. Собирательство здесь интереснее (есть приятное вознаграждение после сбора). 

Но из минусов это тупой сюжет, который мог просто не быть, если бы главные герои просто поговорили. Также, как выставили самих ассасинов (просто те же тамплиеры) 

Ставлю игре 8 из 10!

184162946.review: Assassin’s Creed Rogue is a hidden gem that tells a fascinating story exploring the shades of grey between the Assassins and Templars, revealing that not everything is as it seems. It serves as a prelude to Assassin’s Creed III while connecting to the aftermath of Black Flag. A compelling conclusion to the Colonial America saga, with engaging gameplay and a fresh perspective!

184139421.review: Assassin's Creed Rogue, wydana w 2014 roku, jest jednym z bardziej unikalnych wpisów w serii Ubisoftu. Gra oferuje odświeżające spojrzenie na konflikt między asasynami a templariuszami, przedstawiając historię z perspektywy tych drugich. Choć Rogue często jest nazywana „młodszym bratem” Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag, gra wyróżnia się własnym klimatem, fabułą i mechanikami.Historia rozgrywa się w XVIII wieku, w czasach Wojen Siedmioletnich. Gracz wciela się w Shaya Patricka Cormaca, młodego asasyna, który z czasem staje się templariuszem. To odwrócenie tradycyjnej narracji serii jest jednym z największych atutów gry. Rogue pokazuje, że konflikt między asasynami a templariuszami nie jest czarno-biały, a ich motywacje bywają moralnie skomplikowane.

184080678.review:
Great game. 7/10
Game chơi cũng hay, không đến nổi tệ như những gì trên mạng nói về bản Rogue này.
Ưu điểm:
- Thủy chiến cải thiện hơn trong bản 4 Black Flag
- Map rộng và đẹp
- Cốt truyện tạm ổn, mới lạ
Nhược điểm:
- Như bản 4, tàu chiến là yếu tố chính làm nên thú vị nhưng lại chả thay đổi hình dáng, kích thước, cách bố trí, trang trí nội thất tàu và hệ thống nhân vật thủy thủy. Trong game chỉ có nâng cấp sức mạnh thôi nên nhan chán.
- Thế giới mở vô hồn - NPC chán ngắt (Nhược chung của tất cả dòng Assasin)
- Map rộng nhưng không liền mạch, chia làm 3 khu chính
- Combat trên đất liền chán ngắt
- Nhiệm vụ lặp đi lặp lại
- Không có chế độ Co-op

184080013.review: Assassin’s Creed Rogue is a bit of a mixed bag. On the one hand, the gameplay feels smoother, stuff like the puckle gun is actually useful now, the front cannon does real damage, and the naval fleet missions don’t take forever to reset. On top of that, no multiplayer, which is a huge win for completionists like me who hate multiplayer achievements in single player games. But man, the graphics? Total downgrade from Black Flag. The sails barely move, the foliage looks like it’s straight out of a 2005 game, NPCs are floating, and the water effects are bland as hell. I know it’s a console port, but come on, they could’ve put in a little effort to polish it up. The story’s also confusing as heck, so it’s hard to stay invested. Rogue’s got some great gameplay improvements, but the lack of polish really holds it back. 6/10 but I still recommend it since it's not the most horrible game in the series in my opinion.

La historia que se yo, empezó re bien, me gusto la idea de que Shay se cambie de bando, pero después de esa parte inicial es todo como porque si, porque fueron lindos con Shay cuando los Asesinos no cagaron a tiros. Solo lo recomiendo para personas que sigan la saga, ya que habla de una parte importante entre AC3 y AC4, mas haya de eso...Decepciona. Estoy Triste Joder.

184006773.review:
Что могу сказать об этой части издания Assasin's Creed. Неплохое, среднее по времени прохождения, продолжение предыдущей части Black Flag, а также замечательная предыстория таких частей как: Assasin's Creed Unity и Assasin's Creed III (Да увы, такой поворот).
Смело могу заявить что на данную часть уделили не так много времени как на часть Black Flag.  Это видно сразу: детализация, механика игры, текстуры и прочее. Но гораздо больше чем на дополнение Freedom Cry.
Данная часть порадует замечательным сюжетом, с переворотными событиями. Дает возможность обдумать некоторые поступки. Также приятно наблюдать за белоснежным периодом холодного климата. На воде вас будут периодически встречать ледяные глыбы)
Что могу добавить напоследок: новый персонаж, новые оружия, что ближнего, что дальнего боя. Новая механика(секретное оружие), новые костюмы и новые места для открытия.

Die Mischung aus Gameplay-Elementen von Black Flag und neuen Ideen macht Rogue zu einem unterschätzten Juwel der Serie.

I am giving a thumbs down, but it's a close one.

Anyway, not sure if it changes as you progress, but at the start, there's a lot of naval combat, which just doesn't do it for me. Maybe this changes later, but I got kind of bored and put off by it.

That said, it is interesting to see how the games developed, through time, if that means anything.
